meanings.definition: A majority greater than a simple majority, especially in voting.
meanings.sent1: In order to pass the new rule, we needed supermajorities of the members to agree.
meanings.sent2: The proposal required supermajorities from both sides of the committee to move forward.
meanings.sent3: The idea of having pizza for lunch got supermajorities of approval from the students.
meanings.sent4: Her infectious laughter gained supermajorities of smiles from the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The superhero's strength was like supermajorities of power combined into one.

meanings.definition: A number or proportion that is greater than a simple majority.
meanings.sent1: The team needed supermajorities of players to compete in the tournament.
meanings.sent2: Supermajorities of the budget were allocated to improving the school facilities.
meanings.sent3: The amount of ice cream he ate reached supermajorities of the recommended daily intake.
meanings.sent4: Her collection of stamps was like supermajorities of tiny treasures.
meanings.sent5: The garden was filled with supermajorities of colorful flowers, creating a beautiful sight.
